_header: Now thou unseely body upon bier liest
_description: Address to the body on the bier — nine monorhyming lines

CamTCC323.First Lines:
Nu þu vnseli bodi up on bere listWere bet þine robin of
                    fau & of gris…
CamTCC323.Last Lines:
…þu noldist not þe bi þenchen forte ben wisfor
                    þi hauistu for lorin þe Ioye of parais
CamTCC323.Note:
Translating ‘purpura cum bisso dignum te fecit
                    abysso…’, which precedes ME text.
CamTCC323.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 64.
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 92.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 224-5.
